title: Dacha
summary: A dacha (Russian: дача, IPA: [ˈdatɕə] (listen)) is a seasonal or year-round second home, often located in the exurbs of Russian-speaking and other post-Soviet countries.[1] A cottage (коттедж, kottedzh) or shack serving as a family's main or only home, or an outbuilding, is not considered a dacha,[1] although some dachas recently have been converted to year-round residences and vice versa.
